intro: Coccothrinax radiata, commonly known as the royal palm, is a tropical plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, fan-shaped leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that develop into edible fruits, which are consumed by various wildlife species. Its robust root system allows it to thrive in coastal areas and sandy soils. Coccothrinax radiata is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its elegant form and resilience.
